1.name: Sunset Blvd.
1.description: A screenwriter develops a dangerous relationship with a faded film star determined to make a triumphant return.

2.name: Cinderella
2.description: When Cinderella's cruel stepmother prevents her from attending the Royal Ball, she gets some unexpected help from the lovable mice Gus and Jaq, and from her Fairy Godmother.

3.name: The Asphalt Jungle
3.description: A major heist goes off as planned, until bad luck and double crosses cause everything to unravel.

4.name: All About Eve
4.description: An ingénue insinuates herself into the lives of an established but aging stage actress and her circle of theater friends.

5.name: Rashômon
5.description: The rape of a bride and the murder of her samurai husband are recalled from the perspectives of a bandit, the bride, the samurai's ghost and a woodcutter.

6.name: Mystery Street
6.description: A small town policeman is assisted by a Harvard professor when a human skeleton is found on a Massachusetts beach.

7.name: In a Lonely Place
7.description: A potentially violent screenwriter is a murder suspect until his lovely neighbor clears him. But she begins to have doubts.

8.name: Born to Be Bad
8.description: A woman's attempt to appear innocent and sweet clashes with her lover who sees through her act and the wealthy man she tries to trick into marrying her.

9.name: Rio Grande
9.description: A cavalry officer posted on the Rio Grande must deal with murderous raiding Apaches, his son who's a risk-taking recruit and his wife from whom he has been separated for many years.

10.name: Harvey
10.description: Due to his insistence that he has an invisible six foot-tall rabbit for a best friend, a whimsical middle-aged man is thought by his family to be insane - but he may be wiser than anyone knows.

11.name: Father of the Bride
11.description: The father of a young woman deals with the emotional pain of her getting married, along with the financial and organizational trouble of arranging the wedding.

12.name: Young Man with a Horn
12.description: A young trumpeter enjoys highs (musical success, fame, and fortune) and lows (sour marriage, death of his mentor, bout with alcoholism).

13.name: Treasure Island
13.description: The treasure seeking adventures of young Jim Hawkins and pirate captain Long John Silver.

14.name: Stage Fright
14.description: A struggling actress tries to help a friend prove his innocence when he's accused of murdering the husband of a high society entertainer.

15.name: Broken Arrow
15.description: Tom Jeffords tries to make peace between settlers and Apaches in Arizona territory.

16.name: King Solomon's Mines
16.description: Adventurer Allan Quartermain leads an expedition into uncharted African territory in an attempt to locate an explorer who went missing during his search for the fabled diamond mines of King Solomon.

17.name: The Men
17.description: A paralyzed war vet tries to adjust to the world without the use of his limbs.

18.name: The Sound of Fury
18.description: A man who is down on his luck falls in with a criminal.

19.name: Caged
19.description: A naive nineteen year old widow becomes coarsened and cynical when she is sent to a woman's prison and is exposed to hardened criminals and sadistic guards.

20.name: Winchester '73
20.description: The journey of a prized rifle from one ill-fated owner to another parallels a cowboy's search for a murderous fugitive.

21.name: The Killer That Stalked New York
21.description: Police seek a smuggler while doctors, unaware she's the same person, desperately comb unprotected New York for a smallpox carrier.

22.name: Night and the City
22.description: A small-time grifter and nightclub tout takes advantage of some fortuitous circumstances and tries to become a big-time player as a wrestling promoter.

23.name: Where Danger Lives
23.description: A young doctor falls in love with a disturbed young woman, becomes involved in the death of her husband, and has to flee with her to the Mexican border.

24.name: Los olvidados
24.description: A group of juvenile delinquents live a violent and crime-filled life in the festering slums of Mexico City, and the morals of young Pedro are gradually corrupted and destroyed by the others.

25.name: Summer Stock
25.description: A small-town farmer, down on her luck, finds her homestead invaded by a theatrical troupe invited to stay by her ne'er-do-well sister.

26.name: Gun Crazy
26.description: A well meaning crack shot husband is pressured by his beautiful marksman wife to go on an interstate robbery spree, where he finds out just how depraved and deadly she really is.

27.name: Our Very Own
27.description: Gail discovers the shocking news that she is adopted during a heated argument with her sister, Joan. With the reluctant support of her adoptive parents and baby sister, Penny, Gail goes in ...                See full summary »

28.name: Born Yesterday
28.description: A tycoon hires a tutor to teach his lover proper etiquette, with unexpected results.

29.name: Annie Get Your Gun
29.description: The story of the great sharpshooter Annie Oakley, who rose to fame while dealing with her love/professional rival, Frank Butler.

30.name: Dallas
30.description: A former Confederate officer hunting for an outlaw who wronged him finds him in Dallas, but now as a wealthy, respectable citizen.

31.name: The Gunfighter
31.description: Notorious gunfighter Jimmy Ringo rides into town to find his true love, who doesn't want to see him. He hasn't come looking for trouble, but trouble finds him around every corner.

32.name: Frenchie
32.description: Frenchie Fontaine sells her successful business in New Orleans to come West. Her reason? Find the men who killed her father, Frank Dawson. But she only knows one of the two who did and she's determined to find out the other.

33.name: Cheaper by the Dozen
33.description: "Cheaper By the Dozen", based on the real-life story of the Gilbreth family, follows them from Providence, Rhode Island to Montclair, New Jersey, and details the amusing anecdotes found in ...                See full summary »

34.name: The Glass Menagerie
34.description: Merchant marine officer Tom Wingfield reminisces about his life in St. Louis where he had lived with his nagging mother Amanda and crippled shy sister Laura.

35.name: The Underworld Story
35.description: The story of the fight of a small-town newspaper to free an innocent girl of a murder charge, with the publisher of a metropolitan city newspaper heading, by forced circumstances, the opposing forces.

36.name: The Breaking Point
36.description: An otherwise moral captain of a charter boat becomes financially strapped and is drawn into illegal activities in order to keep up payments on his boat.

37.name: So Long at the Fair
37.description: Vicky Barton visits Paris with her brother Johnny, only to discover the following morning he has gone missing, and the hotel staff have no recollection of his presence.

38.name: Orphée
38.description: A poet in love with Death follows his unhappy wife into the underworld.

39.name: No Way Out
39.description: A black doctor is assigned to treat two white racist suspects who are brothers, and when one dies, it causes tension that could start a race riot.

40.name: Destination Moon
40.description: After their latest rocket fails, Dr. Charles Cargraves and retired General Thayer have to start over again. This time, Gen. Thayer approaches Jim Barnes, the head of his own aviation ...                See full summary »

41.name: Wagon Master
41.description: Two young drifters guide a Mormon wagon train to the San Juan Valley and encounter cutthroats, Indians, geography, and moral challenges on the journey.

42.name: Panic in the Streets
42.description: A doctor and a policeman in New Orleans have only 48 hours to locate a killer infected with pneumonic plague.

43.name: State Secret
43.description: In post-WW2 Europe, when the dictator of a small police state dies during surgery, the operating surgeon, who's a visiting American doctor, is held captive in order to preserve the terrible state secret.

44.name: Where the Sidewalk Ends
44.description: Det. Sgt. Mark Dixon wants to be something his old man wasn't: a guy on the right side of the law. Will Dixon's vicious nature get the better of him?

45.name: Woman on the Run
45.description: When Frank Johnson becomes an eyewitness to a murder, he's pursued around scenic San Francisco by his wife, the police, and the murderer.

46.name: Stromboli, terra di Dio
46.description: Karin, a young woman from the Baltic countries, marries fisherman Antonio to escape from a prison camp. But she cannot get used to the tough life in Antonio's volcano-threatened village, Stromboli.

47.name: Cyrano de Bergerac
47.description: The charismatic swordsman-poet helps another woo the woman he loves in this straightforward version of the play.

48.name: 711 Ocean Drive
48.description: An electronics expert creates a huge bookie broadcast system for his crime boss, and takes over operations when his boss is murdered. His greed leads him on a deadly destructive path.

49.name: The Furies
49.description: A firebrand heiress clashes with her tyrannical father, a cattle rancher who fancies himself a Napoleon, but their relationship turns ugly only when he finds himself a new woman.

50.name: Shûbun
50.description: A celebrity photograph sparks a court case as a tabloid magazine spins a scandalous yarn over a painter and a famous singer.
